title: Longest Common Prefix
description:
Write a function to find the longest common prefix string amongst an array of strings.

If there is no common prefix, return an empty string "".
constraints: strs[i] consists of only lowercase English letters.

examples.explanation: There is no common prefix among the input strings.

starterCode.python:
class Solution:
    def longestCommonPrefix(self, strs: List[str]) -> str:

driverCode.python:
import sys
import json

if __name__ == '__main__':
    line = sys.stdin.read().strip()
    # Simple CSV parser for input string array simulation
    # Actually standard json parser might not work if it's just comma separated words without quotes/brackets in input test case
    # The example input is "flower,flow,flight".
    if line:
        strs = line.split(',')
        strs = [s.strip() for s in strs]
        sol = Solution()
        print(sol.longestCommonPrefix(strs))
